(if solvers are completely clueless as to how to approach this) Look at the 5 on the left side, is it a minesweeper clue or a shakashaka clue? And from that what can we say about the adjacent 0s?
Once you have the completed black/white shakashaka solution, overlay it on top of the original puzzle to see what numbers are underneath the vanilla icing!
Sum numbers in each of the white rectangles, then order by area.
Numbers that are in cells with triangles are to be halved when adding up the sum.
